isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - INJECTION PRESSURE REGULATOR (IPR) - FUNCTION

svcproc.title: FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The Navistar engine control system includes an Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) valve that controls oil pressure in the high pressure injection control system which is used to actuate the injectors. The IPR valve consists of a solenoid, poppet and spool valve assembly and is mounted in the high pressure oil pump. The ECM regulates injection control pressure by controlling the duty cycle or (on/off time) of the injection control pressure solenoid. This increase or decrease of 'on/off" time positions a poppet valve and spool valve internal to the IPR, which in turn either maintains pressure in the injection control pressure system or vents pressure to the oil sump via the front cover. (Refer to Section I ,Engine Control system Overview, in this manual for a more complete description of the IPR operation and function.)
